params.question: Caul suet describes which of the following?

params.text:
Fill in the missing words, read the following paragraph:

Dry Ageing:

 

Dry aging beef to enhance its flavor and tenderness is becoming more popular among consumers, with many butchers now acquiring dry ageing refrigerated units for their shops. Many high-end restaurants have also followed this trend. Dry aging is a process whereby beef carcasses, primals, or sub-primals are stored without packaging at refrigeration temperatures for up to five weeks to allow the natural enzymatic and biochemical process that result in improved tenderness and the development of the unique flavor that can only be described as dry-aged beef.

questions:
Dry aging beef to *enhance* its *flavor* and tenderness is becoming more popular among consumers, with many butchers now acquiring dry ageing refrigerated units for their shops. Many high-end restaurants have also followed this trend.

Dry aging is a process whereby beef carcasses, primals, or sub-primals are stored *without* packaging at *refrigeration* temperatures for up to *five* weeks to allow the natural *enzymatic* and biochemical *process* that result in improved *tenderness* and the development of the *unique* flavor that can only be described as dry-aged beef.

params.textField:
*Pre slaughter care*: Animals destined for meat production must be given careful treatment before slaughter. During transportation they must be fed, given water and loaded onto trucks to prevent injury or stress to the animal. Pre slaughter care has a direct influence on the quality of meat produced.
*Stunning* is required by law. The animal is rendered unconscious by mechanical means by gas or electric captive bolt. While unconscious, the animal is bled in a humane manner.
*Bleeding* is the process by which life is removed. When the animal has been stunned, the carotid artery and the jugular veins are cut allowing an efficient bleed. It is essential to remove the majority of blood, as retained blood becomes an excellent medium for bacterial growth.
*Flaying* or skinning is the removal of the hide from cattle or the fleece from sheep. This task is carried out by hand, and great care must be taken to avoid cuts to the hide / fleece or to the carcass.
*Evisceration* is the removal of the viscera or internal organs.

params.taskDescription: Write down the process of ethical slaughtering?

solution.sample: When meat is cut, the colour of the muscle will usually be a dark, purplish red. After a period of time (usually within 10 minutes), the colour will change to bright red due to oxidation of the muscle. That means that oxygen in the air will be drawn into the meat, causing the colour to become more attractive. Meat bloom is the attractive bright red colour of quality meat.

solution.sample: When meat is cut, the colour of the muscle will usually be a dark, purplish red. After a period of time (usually within 10 minutes), the colour will change to bright red due to oxidation of the muscle. That means that oxygen in the air will be drawn into the meat, causing the colour to become more attractive. Meat bloom is the attractive bright red colour of quality meat.
